ossj.qos.util
Class Log

java.lang.Object
  ossj.qos.util.Log
public class Log
extends java.lang.Object

Title: JSR090 Reference Implementation Description: Log facility. Instead of using System.err or System.out this class should be used by calling the appropiate write method.

Log can be turned on and off by calling method setLogOn().

Log can also be redirected to a file by calling setLogToFile(). The file is stored in current TEMP directory as defined by the system. The name of the file is LOG_FILE_PREFIX+number+LOG_FILE_SUFFIX, for example "log123.log".

It is possible to control the level of logging by setting a log level. The defined levels are:

  • LOG_MAJOR
  • LOG_MINOR (includes LOG_MAJOR level)
  • LOG_ALL (includes LOG_MAJOR and LOG_MINOR levels)
Calling write methods that do not have log level specified is the same as using the LOG_ALL level.

Example: 

   void public aMethod( int value ) {
     Debug.write(this,DEBUG_MINOR,"aMethod()","called with value="+value);
     // do some stuff
   }
Copyright: Copyright 2001 Ericsson Radio Systems AB Company: Ericsson

Version:
0.2

Henrik Lindstrom

setUseShortClassName

public static void setUseShortClassName(boolean useShortClassName)
Set the Log to only write the short class name. This is everything after the last '.' character. This makes the log more compact.

Parameters:
useShortClassName - if true then a shorter class name is written by the write methods.

public static boolean isUseShortClassName()

logOn - if true the log is activated otherwise inactivated.

displayTime - true if time shall be displayed

write

public static void write(java.lang.String logText)
Write text to the log output device. It is adviced to use some of the other more detailed log methods with class and method arguments. Log is only written if log level is set to LOG_ALL.

Parameters:
logText -

write

public static void write(java.lang.Object sender,
                         java.lang.String method,
                         java.lang.String logText)
Write class name, method and text to the log output device. Log is only written if log level is set to LOG_ALL.
